comment: Danelle was my absolute favorite teacher! She is so compassionate about the subject, and keeps classes super interesting and engaging. She only has four graded assignments, three of which I got 100's on. The two tests she gives are open note, but still make sure you study for them because the questions are all short answer. Definitely take her!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Graded by few things

comment: super cool lady, a bit of reading, but not too much. cool projects. great class, would definitely take her again!
Grades consisted of 2 projects, midterm, and final. The projects are up to your own interpretation, so you can be as creative as you want to be. This was a fun class, I would definitely recommend!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things--Caring

comment: One of the best professors I have had in 2 years of college. She gives little homework and explains everything for us to succeed. She is so caring and holds my attention with humor. I highly recommend her!

I only took American Identities because it was a learning community, so I was already pretty uninterested. With that being said, Professor Dyckhoff was super cool and wasn't too lecture heavy. 3 main projects with one of them being a group project. As long as you come to class and participate some of the time you can make an A. Take her.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Professor Dyckhoff was easily the best professor I had all semester. She is so sweet and truly cares for her students. The class is super easy however you will read the textbook quite a bit and she will quiz you on your material. As long as you are reading and showing up, the class is an easy A
rating_tags: Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Caring

comment: If you chose to take her, you will not regret it. I absolutely loved her. She is one of the best professors at KSU if you ask me. This class is an easy A but you do need to read the text book to do well on quizzes. I would take this class with her a million times over.

Professor Dyckhoff is cares so much about her students. I'm in a learning community 1st Gen Owls. She's really passionate about what she's teaching. Best professor I've had so far and would definitely go see her again just to talk. Highly recommend this class!

Professor Danelle is super nice and relatable. She makes it very clear as to what she expects from you, you just have to do it and you'll end up with an A. She lets you use notes and the book for your midterm and final. She is there for you outside of class if needed as well. HIGHLY RECOMMEND. Without a doubt my favorite professor thus far.

Professor Danelle Dyckhoff Stelzriede is easily one of my favorite teachers. She is very kind and cares deeply for her students. She made KSU1101 bearable and fun. There is a lot of group work and class participation can make or break your grade. open notes for midterm and final makes it even easier to pass. All around a great teacher.
Professor Danelle is a new teacher at KSU and makes freshman seminar pretty fun. She does a lot of group work and allows mid term and final to be open book.

Danelle is an amazing professor. She was by far my favorite and her and I also established a great student-teacher relationship. She genuinely cares for her students and makes the class a lot of fun. At first I was not a fan because of the amount of work she gives, but it is mainly busy work. But as the semester went on, she made it easier.

Very "extra". To be a Freshman seminar class she takes it way too seriously. Had more homework for this class than any other class. All of this being said, none of the work is hard. Very time consuming. Papers, group work, and presentations to make you explore KSU

Prof Dyckhoff is amazing!! The class is very presentation and group project heavy, but she makes it so easy and comfortable for everyone. Only 1 presentation is done solo, the rest are group ones. Workload is not a lot at all. MIDTERM AND FINAL ARE OPEN NOTES AND BOOK!!! And she allows 4 absences before it starts to hurt your grade.

Professor Dyckhoff was great! She's the nicest and most understanding teacher. There are a lot of projects, but most are group projects and not that bad. Make sure to take notes and pay attention because midterm and final are open notes. Overall, I'm glad that I got this professor! Would definitely recommend.
